benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered: PUT Method - Valid Request: Successful 204 response with empty body; host transitions from out-of-rotation to in-rotation and remains unchanged if already in rotation (idempotency).
PUT Method - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent PUTs complete without race conditions and yield a consistent final state.
Authorization: Unauthorized (401) and Forbidden (403) paths validated, including missing auth header.
Service Availability: Endpoint unavailability returns 503 with error messaging.
Resilience: Transient network interruption and retry behavior verified.
Performance: Response time thresholds are exercised under degraded performance.
Security Hardening: Header injection attempt does not compromise the system.
Input-free endpoint semantics: No request body required; extraneous headers tolerated.
gaps: Error Contract and Content-Type: The story states Produces application/json, but tests do not assert Content-Type for error responses or validate a JSON error schema.
Server Error Handling: No scenario simulates an internal failure (e.g., 500) even though the story requires >=400 on errors.

Unexpected Payload Policy: Test assumes a non-empty body still succeeds with 204, but the story says Request Body: N/A. Behavior for unexpected body and/or unsupported Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) is not defined or verified.
Additional Method Handling: No coverage for HEAD/POST/DELETE to ensure 405/Allow header, or OPTIONS to list allowed methods.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario validating 429 behavior or headers when many requests are issued in a short period.
Content Negotiation: No tests for unsupported Accept headers leading to 406 or defaulting behavior.
recommendations: Add scenarios to assert the error contract: verify Content-Type: application/json and a well-defined JSON error structure (code/message) for 4xx/5xx responses.
Introduce a simulated internal error (e.g., backend failure) to validate a 500 response and correct error body.
Clarify and test unexpected payload behavior: either reject with 400/415 (and verify) or explicitly document and assert that the server ignores bodies. Include tests for invalid Content-Type.
Expand method handling tests: POST/DELETE/HEAD should return 405 with an Allow header; OPTIONS should enumerate allowed methods.
If applicable, add rate limiting tests that trigger or verify absence of 429 responses under burst load, including Retry-After headers when throttled.
Add content negotiation tests: send unsupported Accept values (e.g., text/plain) and verify 406 or documented fallback.
Optionally, add a sequential idempotency test (repeating PUT multiple times) to complement concurrency coverage and confirm no additional side effects.
